qas.question: What trade did Popper enter as an apprentice?
What type of facility did Popper plan to open that would benefit from his furniture-making skills?
In which psychoanalysts clinics did Popper volunteer?
When did Popper become an ordinary student rather than a guest at university?
For which vocation did Popper complete his university examinations?
What was easy for Popper to cope with?
Who owned the clinic for adults that Popper volunteered at?
When did Popper leave the Pädagogisches Institut?
When did Popper join the university as a guest student?
When did Popper complete his examination as a university teacher?

context: He worked in street construction for a short amount of time, but was unable to cope with the <b5_0>heavy labour<b5_0/>. Continuing to attend university as a guest student, he started an apprenticeship as <a0_0>cabinetmaker<a0_0/>, which he completed as a journeyman. He was dreaming at that time of starting a <a1_0>daycare<a1_0/> facility for children, for which he assumed the ability to make furniture might be useful. After that he did voluntary service in one of psychoanalyst <a2_0><b6_0>Alfred Adler<b6_0/><a2_0/>'s clinics for children. In <a3_0><b8_0>1922<b8_0/><a3_0/>, he did his matura by way of a second chance education and finally joined the University as an ordinary student. He completed his examination as an <a4_0>elementary teacher<a4_0/> in <b9_0>1924<b9_0/> and started working at an after-school care club for socially endangered children. In <b7_0>1925<b7_0/>, he went to the newly founded Pädagogisches Institut and continued studying philosophy and psychology. Around that time he started courting Josefine Anna Henninger, who later became his wife.
